intro: Gonolobus uniflorus, commonly known as the single-flower goonolobus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or pea family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with a distinctive spurred structure at the base of the petals. Gonolobus uniflorus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
